Description: Large Nile silt pottery vase, coated with red slip and burnished; with flat base, convex sides, short neck and everted rim, base restored.
Curator's comments: Illustrated in: A.J. Spencer, Pottery in Predynastic Egypt in I. Freestone and D. Gaimster, Pottery in the Making: World ceramic traditions. British Museum Press, London (1997), p. 45. Polished red ware P40a in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
